alert.note: Alert for Broome; Delaware; Sullivan; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following areas, in central New York, Broome, Delaware, Sullivan and Tioga. In northeast Pennsylvania, Bradford, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike, Wayne, Susquehanna and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until Midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain from thunderstorms on very wet or saturated surfaces will create the potential for rapid runoff and flash flooding. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
